Deployment Guide

Deploy your PhilJS application to any platform including Vercel, Cloudflare Workers, AWS Lambda, Docker, and traditional servers.

Building for Production

First, create an optimized production build:

TypeScript Projects

Terminal
$# Build static site or SPA
$npm run build
$
$# Build SSR application
$npm run build:ssr
$
$# Preview the production build locally
$npm run preview

Rust Projects

Terminal
$# Build optimized WASM
$cargo philjs build --release
$
$# Build SSR server
$cargo build --release --features ssr
$
$# Build for specific target
$cargo philjs build --release --target x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

Vercel

Vercel provides the easiest deployment experience with zero configuration:

Terminal
$# Install Vercel CLI
$npm i -g vercel
$
$# Deploy
$vercel

For SSR applications, add a vercel.json:

vercel.jsonjson
1{
2  "buildCommand": "npm run build:ssr",
3  "outputDirectory": "dist",
4  "framework": null,
5  "functions": {
6    "api/**/*.ts": {
7      "runtime": "nodejs20.x"
8    }
9  },
10  "rewrites": [
11    { "source": "/(.*)", "destination": "/api/ssr" }
12  ]
13}

Cloudflare Pages & Workers

Deploy to Cloudflare's global edge network for ultra-low latency:

Cloudflare Pages (Static)

Terminal
$npm run build
$npx wrangler pages deploy dist

Cloudflare Workers (SSR)

wrangler.tomltoml
1// wrangler.toml
2name = "my-philjs-app"
3main = "dist/worker.js"
4compatibility_date = "2024-01-01"
5 
6[site]
7bucket = "./dist/static"
8 
9[build]
10command = "npm run build:worker"
src/worker.tstypescript
1// src/worker.ts
2import { renderToString } from 'philjs-ssr';
3import App from './App';
4 
5export default {
6  async fetch(request: Request, env: Env): Promise<Response> {
7    const url = new URL(request.url);
8 
9    // Serve static assets
10    const asset = await env.ASSETS.fetch(request);
11    if (asset.status !== 404) return asset;
12 
13    // SSR for all other routes
14    const html = await renderToString(() => <App url={url.pathname} />);
15 
16    return new Response(html, {
17      headers: {
18        'Content-Type': 'text/html',
19        'Cache-Control': 'public, max-age=60',
20      },
21    });
22  },
23};
Terminal
$npx wrangler deploy

AWS

AWS Lambda with API Gateway

serverless.ymlyaml
1// serverless.yml
2service: philjs-app
3 
4provider:
5  name: aws
6  runtime: nodejs20.x
7  region: us-east-1
8  memorySize: 1024
9  timeout: 10
10 
11functions:
12  ssr:
13    handler: dist/lambda.handler
14    events:
15      - http: ANY /
16      - http: ANY /{proxy+}
17 
18plugins:
19  - serverless-offline
20 
21custom:
22  serverless-offline:
23    httpPort: 3000
src/lambda.tstypescript
1// src/lambda.ts
2import { APIGatewayProxyHandler } from 'aws-lambda';
3import { renderToString } from 'philjs-ssr';
4import App from './App';
5 
6export const handler: APIGatewayProxyHandler = async (event) => {
7  const path = event.path;
8 
9  const html = await renderToString(() => <App url={path} />);
10 
11  return {
12    statusCode: 200,
13    headers: {
14      'Content-Type': 'text/html',
15    },
16    body: html,
17  };
18};

S3 + CloudFront (Static)

Terminal
$# Build
$npm run build
$
$# Sync to S3
$aws s3 sync dist s3://my-bucket --delete
$
$# Invalidate CloudFront cache
$aws cloudfront create-invalidation --distribution-id XXXXX --paths "/*"

Docker

Container deployment for maximum portability:

TypeScript Dockerfile

Dockerfiledockerfile
1# Build stage
2FROM node:20-alpine AS builder
3WORKDIR /app
4COPY package*.json ./
5RUN npm ci
6COPY . .
7RUN npm run build
8 
9# Production stage
10FROM node:20-alpine
11WORKDIR /app
12ENV NODE_ENV=production
13 
14COPY --from=builder /app/dist ./dist
15COPY --from=builder /app/package*.json ./
16RUN npm ci --production
17 
18EXPOSE 3000
19CMD ["node", "dist/server.js"]

Rust Dockerfile

Dockerfiledockerfile
1# Build stage
2FROM rust:1.75-alpine AS builder
3RUN apk add --no-cache musl-dev
4WORKDIR /app
5COPY . .
6RUN cargo build --release --features ssr
7 
8# Production stage
9FROM alpine:latest
10RUN apk add --no-cache ca-certificates
11WORKDIR /app
12 
13COPY --from=builder /app/target/release/myapp ./
14COPY --from=builder /app/static ./static
15COPY --from=builder /app/pkg ./pkg
16 
17EXPOSE 8080
18CMD ["./myapp"]
Terminal
$# Build image
$docker build -t my-philjs-app .
$
$# Run container
$docker run -p 3000:3000 my-philjs-app

Fly.io

Deploy globally with Fly.io:

fly.tomltoml
1# fly.toml
2app = "my-philjs-app"
3primary_region = "iad"
4 
5[build]
6  dockerfile = "Dockerfile"
7 
8[http_service]
9  internal_port = 3000
10  force_https = true
11  auto_stop_machines = true
12  auto_start_machines = true
13  min_machines_running = 0
14 
15[[vm]]
16  memory = "256mb"
17  cpu_kind = "shared"
18  cpus = 1
Terminal
$flyctl launch
$flyctl deploy

Railway

railway.jsonjson
1# railway.json
2{
3  "$schema": "https://railway.app/railway.schema.json",
4  "build": {
5    "builder": "NIXPACKS"
6  },
7  "deploy": {
8    "startCommand": "npm start",
9    "healthcheckPath": "/health",
10    "restartPolicyType": "ON_FAILURE"
11  }
12}

Static Hosting

For static sites without SSR, you can deploy to any static host:

PlatformDeploy Command
Netlifynetlify deploy --prod --dir=dist
GitHub PagesPush to gh-pages branch
Surgesurge dist my-app.surge.sh
Firebasefirebase deploy

Environment Variables

Handle environment-specific configuration:

vite.config.tstypescript
1// vite.config.ts
2import { defineConfig, loadEnv } from 'vite';
3import philjs from 'philjs-compiler/vite';
4 
5export default defineConfig(({ mode }) => {
6  const env = loadEnv(mode, process.cwd(), '');
7 
8  return {
9    plugins: [philjs()],
10    define: {
11      // Expose safe env vars to client
12      'import.meta.env.API_URL': JSON.stringify(env.API_URL),
13      'import.meta.env.PUBLIC_KEY': JSON.stringify(env.PUBLIC_KEY),
14    },
15  };
16});
!

Security

Never expose secret keys or credentials in client-side code. Use server-side environment variables for sensitive data.

Performance Optimization

  • Code Splitting: Use dynamic imports for route-based splitting
  • Asset Optimization: Enable Vite's built-in image/font optimization
  • Compression: Enable Brotli/Gzip compression on your server
  • CDN: Serve static assets from a CDN for global performance
  • Caching: Set appropriate cache headers for static assets
  • Preloading: Use <link rel="preload"> for critical assets
App.tsxtsx
1// Lazy load routes
2const Dashboard = lazy(() => import('./pages/Dashboard'));
3const Settings = lazy(() => import('./pages/Settings'));
4 
5function App() {
6  return (
7    <Router>
8      <Suspense fallback={<Loading />}>
9        <Route path="/dashboard" component={Dashboard} />
10        <Route path="/settings" component={Settings} />
11      </Suspense>
12    </Router>
13  );
14}

Monitoring & Observability

Set up error tracking and performance monitoring:

src/monitoring.tstypescript
1// src/monitoring.ts
2import * as Sentry from '@sentry/browser';
3import { createEffect } from 'philjs-core';
4 
5// Initialize error tracking
6Sentry.init({
7  dsn: import.meta.env.SENTRY_DSN,
8  environment: import.meta.env.MODE,
9  tracesSampleRate: 0.1,
10});
11 
12// Track navigation performance
13export function trackPageView(path: string) {
14  const navigationTiming = performance.getEntriesByType('navigation')[0];
15 
16  analytics.track('page_view', {
17    path,
18    loadTime: navigationTiming.loadEventEnd - navigationTiming.startTime,
19    ttfb: navigationTiming.responseStart - navigationTiming.requestStart,
20  });
21}
22 
23// Error boundary with reporting
24export function ErrorBoundary(props: { children: any }) {
25  return (
26    <ErrorBoundaryCore
27      fallback={(err) => {
28        Sentry.captureException(err);
29        return <ErrorPage error={err} />;
30      }}
31    >
32      {props.children}
33    </ErrorBoundaryCore>
34  );
35}
